usx.para: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians

Paul and Timothy, servants of Christ Jesus, to all the ones set apart in Christ Jesus who are at Philippi, with the overseers and deacons. Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
I give thanks for your fellowship in the gospel from the first day until now. I am confident of this very thing, that he who began a good work in you will complete it until the day of Jesus Christ.
If there is therefore any encouragement in Christ, if any comfort from his love, if any fellowship of the Spirit, if any tender mercies and compassions,

Do nothing through selfishness or empty pride, but instead in lowliness of mind count others better than yourself. Do not look out for each of your own needs, but also look out for the needs of others.
